adp_connection.lib package¶

Submodules¶

adp_connection.lib.adpapiconnection module¶

class adp_connection.lib.adpapiconnection.ADPAPIConnection[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for maintaining ADP connection status and information

Instance Variables: connection: dictionary storing the connection status and access-token information connectionConfiguration: instance of the ConnectionConfiguration class that was used to instantiate the connection

connect()[source]¶

Sends a POST to the ADP Token Server URL with necessary options and data like grant_type, ssl certificates, clientID and clientSecret. Upon a successful response, updates the connection information with the appropriate status and access-token data. Also sets to sessionState if not already set. On an unsuccessful attempt a ConnectError exception is raised

connection = {'status': 'availabe', 'token': '', 'expires': '', 'type': 'unknown', 'sessionState': ''}¶
connectionConfiguration = None¶
disconnect()[source]¶

Sends a logout request to ADP if an access-token is present and resets the connection instance variable for the connection

getAccessToken()[source]¶

Returns: the access-token (Bearer Token) that was obtained as a result of a successful connection. Returns and empty string if no access-token is present

getConfig()[source]¶

Returns: the Connection Configuration object associated with the connection. The object maybe either ClientCredentialsConfiguration or AuthorizationCodeConfiguration depending on the type of application

getExpiration()[source]¶

Returns: the expiration date-time of the access-token as a datetime type. Returns an empty string if no access-token exists

getSessionState()[source]¶

Returns: the session state identifier that may have been generated either automatically, or user-defined when the connect() is successful

isConnectedIndicator()[source]¶

Returns: a boolen depending on whether the connection is ‘connected’ or not

setSessionState(sessionState)[source]¶

Inputs: sessionState: a string that uniquely identifies a session (e.g. a UUID)

userAgent = 'adp-userinfo-python/1.0.1'¶
class adp_connection.lib.adpapiconnection.AuthorizationCodeConnection(connConfig)[source]¶

Bases: adp_connection.lib.adpapiconnection.ADPAPIConnection

Extends the ADPAPIConnection base class for an Authorization Code type application

Attributes: connConfig: instance of AuthorizationCodeConfiguration

connect()[source]¶

Sends a POST to the ADP Token Server URL with necessary options. These options are a little different from those sent for the client_credentials app. These include client_id, client_secret, grant_type, code (authorization_code), redirect_uri, and SSL certificates. Upon a successful response, updates the connection information with the appropriate status and access-token data. Also sets to sessionState if not already set. On an unsuccessful attempt a ConnectError exception is raised

getAuthorizationURL()[source]¶

Generates a URL that must be used for redirecting the user’s browser to for allowing them to login into ADP. The query parameters of the url are client_id, response_type, redirect_uri, scope and state. All the parameters except for state are obtained from the configuration object that was used for creating the connection. The state parameter is meant for allowing tracking of the session between the stateless http calls. If it has not been previously set to a user-defined value, it is set to a UUID when this method is called

Returns: string representing the URL for redirecting the browser

class adp_connection.lib.adpapiconnection.ClientCredentialsConnection(connConfig)[source]¶

Extends the ADPAPIConnection base class for a Client Credentials type application

adp_connection.lib.adpapiconnectionfactory module¶

class adp_connection.lib.adpapiconnectionfactory.ADPAPIConnectionFactory[source]¶

Creates a connection instance and returns either a ClientCredentialsConnection or an AuthorizationCodeConnection depending on the initialized connection configuration provided

Bases: adp_connection.lib.connectexceptions.Error

Exception raised for errors in connecting to ADP.

exception adp_connection.lib.connectexceptions.Error(cname, code, msg)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Base class for exceptions in this module.

Attributes:
cname – class in which the error occurred code – error code msg – error message
errDict = {'sslKeyPath': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-004', 'errMsg': 'sslKeyPath not set'}, 'clientSecret': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-002', 'errMsg': 'clientSecret not set'}, 'grantType': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-008', 'errMsg': 'grantType not set'}, 'scopeBad': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-013', 'errMsg': 'incorrect scope'}, 'tokenServerURL': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-005', 'errMsg': 'tokenServerURL not set'}, 'initBad': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-014', 'errMsg': 'configuration not inited'}, 'disconnectURL': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-007', 'errMsg': 'disconnectURL not set'}, 'clientID': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-001', 'errMsg': 'clientID not set'}, 'responseTypeBad': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-013', 'errMsg': 'incorrect responseType'}, 'sslCertPath': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-003', 'errMsg': 'sslCertPath not set'}, 'scope': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-012', 'errMsg': 'scope not set'}, 'redirectURL': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-010', 'errMsg': 'redirectURL not set'}, 'responseType': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-011', 'errMsg': 'responseType not set'}, 'baseAuthorizationURL': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-009', 'errMsg': 'baseAuthorizationURL not set'}, 'apiRequestURL': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-006', 'errMsg': 'apiRequestURL not set'}, 'grantTypeBad': {'errCode': 'ConfErr-013', 'errMsg': 'incorrect grant type'}}¶

class adp_connection.lib.connectionconfiguration.ConnectionConfiguration[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for the connection configuration object.

Instance Variables: config: a dictionary of all the configuration parameters required for setting up a connection initDone: tracks whether the configuration has been initialized
